thread.title: Exploring Portugal’s colorful Coimbra
thread.title_full: Exploring Portugal’s colorful Coimbra - San Francisco Chronicle

author: By Rick Steves
title: Exploring Portugal’s colorful Coimbra
text:
Photo: Dominic Arizona Bonuccelli, Rick Steves' Europe print_article_embed|photo-8117594|article-6387694|7 comments_jump_embed|photo-8117594|article-6387694|1 email_share_embed|photo-8117594|article-6387694|1 facebook_share_embed|photo-8117594|article-6387694|2 twitter_share_embed|photo-8117594|article-6387694|3 pinterest_share_embed|photo-8117594|article-6387694|4 reddit_share_embed|photo-8117594|article-6387694|5 google_share_embed|photo-8117594|article-6387694|6 Coimbra’s main pedestrian drag, which divides the lower and upper parts of the old town, is a delight to explore. Coimbra’s main pedestrian drag, which divides the lower and upper...
A couple of hours north of Lisbon, Coimbra is the Oxford or Cambridge of Portugal — the home of its most venerable university. It’s also the country’s easiest-to-enjoy city — a mini-Lisbon, with everything good about urban Portugal without the intensity of a big metropolis. I couldn’t design a more delightful city for a visit. Coimbra’s main pedestrian drag, which divides the lower and upper parts of the old town, is a delight to explore. Coimbra’s main pedestrian drag, which divides the lower and upper...
A couple of hours north of Lisbon, Coimbra is the Oxford or Cambridge of Portugal — the home of its most venerable university. It’s also the country’s easiest-to-enjoy city — a mini-Lisbon, with everything good about urban Portugal without the intensity of a big metropolis. I couldn’t design a more delightful city for a visit.
